p:
The HIV genetic network was inferred with HIV-TRACE,
34 establishing putative transmission links between PLWH whose HIV sequences had a genetic distance of <1.5%. Inferred links were then resolved into clusters for further analysis. The genetic network was reconstructed after removing all of the major DRMs
33 from the sequences so that they would not impact the genetic distance comparison, but the resulting network was unchanged. Newmanâ€™s assortativity coefficients for age and location of residence were estimated using the R package igraph. Null distributions to assess assortativity significance were obtained with the R sample function to create a random distribution with 1000 iterations.
35 Geospatial dispersal was determined by calculating the average distance between centroids of the municipalities of residence of genetically linked individuals.
